title: League Patching Causes Entire Computer to Freeze
body:
Early I was getting the League RADS Https error, I system restored my computer and managed to finally get past it. Now, after uninstalling and reinstalling, I'm working on updating back to normal, but at random times the download just stops counting up. Then, windows explorer freezes, my entire computer freezes, and I have to do a hard restart.

I tried uninstalled league with a 3rd party uninstaller - Iobit, using ccleaner, using disk check and scanning my drivers for issues. Nothing seems conclusive.

Just did an entire rollback of my computer while keeping my files intact to see if that works. While I'm updating once more, I'm looking for any other solutions that might help me get around this.

replies.body:
Hmmmm.....that RADS error is typically caused by a permissions issue, in which case our [**permissions guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) could fix that right up. It sounds like you've tried a *lot* of different steps to fix this that might have actually caused more problems in the long run. 

Let's go ahead and get you over to our tech experts in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so that they can walk you through the steps to get this finally smoothed out for you.
